info.abstract:
[Behaviour] It is a stored procedure used to transform an implicit dimension into an explicit one.
[Parameters] - input fragment : name of the input fragment. - size : product of the sizes of dimensions to be transformed. - residual : product of the sizes of dimensions that remain implicit. - output fragment : name of the output fragment. - is compressed : 1 if data are compressed, 0 otherwise.
[Return type] Void.
[Examples] Considering the implicit dimension 'time' (its size is 360), get a table in which each row is related to a value of the n-tuple (lat, lon, depth, time). oph_drill_down('input_fragment', 360, 1, 'output_fragment', 1)
